intro: Piqueria trinervia var. luxurians, commonly known as the Mexican fireweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to drought conditions. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three narrow, lance-shaped leaflets. It is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued for its ornamental qualities.
